title: Gauge-chart Configuration
description: A circular gauge widget for displaying single numeric values within a defined range. Use this widget to show KPIs, sensor readings, progress indicators, or any metric that benefits from a visual representation against minimum and maximum boundaries. Supports color-coded sections to indicate value zones (e.g., normal/warning/critical), multiple gauges in one widget, and automatic pivot-based generation from data columns. Ideal for real-time monitoring dashboards showing temperature, speed, utilization, or similar bounded metrics.

title.title: Title
title.description: The main heading displayed above the gauge(s). Use to describe what metric is being shown (e.g., 'CPU Temperature', 'Tank Level').

subTitle.title: Subtitle
subTitle.description: Secondary text displayed below the title. Use for additional context like location, device name, or measurement conditions.

dataseries.title: Gauges
dataseries.description: Array of gauge configurations. Each entry creates a separate gauge dial that can display different metrics or the same metric for different entities (via pivot).

label.title: Label
label.description: The name displayed below or inside the gauge to identify what value it shows. Appears in legends when multiple gauges are present.

valueColor.title: Value Color
valueColor.description: The color of the numeric value text displayed on the gauge. Use a contrasting color for readability.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The measurement unit displayed after the value (e.g., 'Â°C', 'km/h', '%', 'PSI'). Keep short for better display.

precision.title: Decimals
precision.description: Number of decimal places to display (e.g., 0 for whole numbers, 1 for 23.5, 2 for 23.45). Default is 0.

multiChart.title: Multi Chart
multiChart.description: When enabled, automatically creates multiple gauges based on distinct values in a pivot column. Use when you have one data table containing values for multiple entities (e.g., temperatures for multiple devices).

value.title: Value
value.description: The numeric value to display on the gauge. Can be bound to a data column for real-time updates. Used when Multi Chart is disabled.

data.title: Data
data.description: Data array for Multi Chart mode. Only the latest value per pivot group is displayed unless averaging is configured. Provide timestamp for data freshness indication.

tsp.title: Timestamp
tsp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp string (e.g., '2023-11-04T22:47:52.351152+00:00'). Used to detect data age and apply maxLatency filtering if configured.

value.title: Value
value.description: The numeric measurement value for this data point.

pivot.title: Split Data by
pivot.description: Column value used to split data into multiple gauges. Each unique value creates a separate gauge (e.g., device_id creates one gauge per device).

sections.title: Gauge Color Sections
sections.description: Configure the gauge scale range and color zones to indicate value severity or status levels.

gaugeMinValue.title: Gauge Start Value
gaugeMinValue.description: The minimum value shown on the gauge scale (left-most point). Default is 0. Set to negative for metrics that can go below zero.

sectionLimits.title: Section Right Limits
sectionLimits.description: Define color zones by specifying the upper boundary and color for each section. Sections are drawn from the gauge minimum to the first limit, then between consecutive limits.

limit.title: Right Limit
limit.description: The upper boundary value for this color section. The last section's limit defines the gauge maximum.

sectionColor.title: Section Color
sectionColor.description: The fill color for this section of the gauge arc. Use semantic colors like green for normal, yellow for warning, red for critical.

advanced.title: Advanced Configuration
advanced.description: Additional settings for data processing and display behavior.

averageLatest.title: Average Latest Values
averageLatest.description: Calculate a rolling average over the specified number of most recent data points. Useful for smoothing noisy sensor data. Leave empty to show raw latest value.

maxLatency.title: Maximum Latency in seconds
maxLatency.description: Maximum age (in seconds) for data to be displayed. If the latest data point's timestamp is older than this threshold, the gauge shows no value or a stale indicator. Useful for detecting sensor offline conditions.
